Html:
I found a  workaround to get this working: http://www.wpftutorial.net/PasswordBox.html

Though, it seems like there should be a cleaner way to handle this, does anyone know of a cleaner way to handle the issue of getting the password from a password box while maintaining the MVVM approach. I don't need to actually bind the password to a property, but if I can pass it in as a command parameter that would be the most ideal.

With the hack method I am binding to a property, which for some reason has it's updatetrigger to propertychanged and can't be overridden. As well, this workaround also forces you to specify the Mode=TwoWay instead of defaulting to it.

Hi,

You can read the following threads on WPF forums where PasswordBox, databinding and security topics are covered.

  • How to binding data to PasswordBox
  • Unable to data-bind to a PasswordBox

Since this is not strictly related to Prism, you might find better support on WPF forums.

I hope you find this information useful.

Thanks,
